header.rec_loc: Flatmate/close friendâ€™s bedroom in university halls, Lancaster University
header.relationships: Close family, partners, very close friends
header.topics: Mental health, missing university seminars, university stress, the lottery, wealth
header.activity: Two flatmates talking together about mental health issues and worries

you know?

and you've had a lot of time f like to yourself which is gonna make it kind of more difficult to get back int like like for you now like the abnormal is normal

so like not doing is the norm which isn't your fault at all
because literally like I've been there and it's
yeah
horrible because you can't do anything like even if you try

oh
but it just it's just so stupid as well like there's just no reason to think like that
it's not stupid
cos I mean I do think like that and it's fine cos I don't
cos it affects it it all affects your brain yeah

cos if you think about it like you know? it's it's an impairment
yeah
it's a disability like it's stops you from functioning normally and not normally but you know what I mean it it stops you from functioning as you would be if you were healthy
mm

you know? and that's hard it's not to say that you can't be healthy again but like this isn't how it's gonna be for ever and ever but to actually get rid of it well not get rid of it but to be able to control it and get into like a stage where you can cope with it or even see it as maybe less powerful than it is you know? like I know it's quite like typical to say oh yeah you just have to beat it I'm not that kind of person that's like you have to push past this
and you have to keep trying but then like the more you let it kind of the thing is like it it makes you think that it's you that doesn't wanna do anything
yeah
which is really horrible isn't it because like?
I feel like it's my fault and I don't know whether that is true or not
it's not your fault
like I really don't any more like the way my family were like like talking to me it sounded as though it was my fault and then I felt really awful about it and that's when I was like
I mean from the outside people do think well people can think it's your fault because the symptoms of it are just like you don't want to do things
I think it is
but it's how is it your how is your fault that you feel like this?

I don't know because this is just how I am like I've just this is just my personality now it's not even it doesn't even feel like it's you know there's something wrong with my brain it's just the way I am
I think you can be a cynical person

and be able to get out of bed and be able to feel able to do things I don't think there's correlation that much correlation there I think you can be somebody that like it's not I don't i I don't think it's just because you might have a negative view of things
yeah

like it might help sometime like it might've contributed to it but I'm I'm certain that just because like you're maybe not as like mm you've got such like a spiritual outlook of the world some people have you know? it doesn't it doesn't mean that like you know? cos it's not it's not part of your personality to be like constantly like upset and constantly worried like outside factors contribute to that it's not just like oh I'm so I'm like this it's not and I know hhow it just it just feels permanent and it sucks but it's not I mean u like you've said that over summer you didn't feel very good like when you were at home like did y did it feel it di obviously didn't feel very good but did it feel like less stressful than this because you didn't actually have responsibility then or were your family onto you so it was pretty hard?
I mean it was stressful in a different way like it was
yeah yeah
erm the stakes are a lot higher
yeah yeah
you know if I get if if things fall apart here then like that's just really bad because
mm
you know there's a lot of money involved here and there are a lot of serious
oh god there's definitely a lot of money

important things involved here like that would be affected if I decided to fuck things up which I have done but whereas at home it was like if I if I like acted out or something the only thing that would affect would be like my family
mm

and that did upset me but it didn't w no it did stress me out but like like who like in a different way like yeah I dunno I just feel like I'm gonna feel like this wherever I go really and I'm always gonna have the same pressure from my family

I don't I don't even know any more
is that what?
they want me to do well up here cos they think I can
mm
they think I have it in me and I really don't it's not there
it isn't fair
it cos
cos it's not that you're not capable of getting good grades that you're not smart it's because right now you're not in the right position to be able to apply yourself

that isn't it's not fair and it's not that is not your fault
and maybe when you actually start getting like proper regular help and let it kick in a bit
no but that's just not happening here it's just not happening it's like I

if I made another appointment it would take a week at least
to actually? are they not like putting regular slots in or anything like that?
no
why?

well cos oon on Friday I went to like the acute kind of thing because that's the only way you can get a faster appointment at the doctor's so I did that and I went to see a nurse and then she made me appoi an appointment for yesterday which I obviously missed
mm

and that's the problem like and I haven't called them back because I don't have any signal and I haven't been outside but if I were to call them back they would tell me like this is when the next appointment's available or you'd have to go through the acute team again
oh my god
and back to where you came from and it's just
that's crazy
it's just straight back to square one and it's really frustrating and they don't give you like repeat appointments like all the time and the counselling appointment's like once every Friday
oh god
and it's like why would you put it at the end of the week you know? it's just fucking stupid I get one appointment every week and it's on Friday and it's with a woman who wants me to
leave?
to leave
yeah
and also like do CBT like try things during the week that I just can't cope with most of the time because I'm too worried about everything else and it's just not helpful
what's the sort of thing she asks you to do?
I don't know so even like difficult stuff it's just basic things like getting out of bed and eating properly and going for walks and it's just not helpful at the minute
mm
it's not what I want
I think a bad of it well the part of that's probably really hard is that like it feels like there's too much now to actually control
yeah it feels really out of my hands
like those u yeah
I feel like I've messed it up way too much I really have done a really good job of fucking stuff up for myself so far
and it can still be
I don't think it can
I think it can
I

I think it feel cos it's going on in your life and because it affects you most like more than anybody and because obviously you're stressed you're stressed and you're anxious about everything that s you're not done or n things that you've done like from looking at it from the outside I'm sure a lot of students have been in this situation you've not committed any crimes

you've not gone to your lectures because you felt depressed you've not handed in assignments because you not functioned you've n you've not been able to function or to do the work and if you think about it that's it like I know that's big it's important but it's not as many individual problems as you think and it's not like I'm sure the lecturers here will've had experience with students like that like these are common problems
yeah
they're horrible problems but they're common
yeah

erm I'm sure a degree level student particularly at their first time away it's usually like the worst like the first time you go to university if you have any problems you'll have them in your first year
well that's the point of first year isn't it?
mm
to be and to adjust
exactly like you can fuck up in first year a little bit

like obviously you've gotta get the forty percent pass mark but I think it allows you a bit of leeway to like and I know it's not just missing assignments and missing someone else's problem it's actually when like sitting down doing the work and
yeah
then actually thinking about it
and I have this intense fear of just doing it wrong and and getting feedback and then reading my work and
I know

tense yeah

know what I mean? I don't think I can do it right
you would well not been good enough for it

like cos in my head I feel like I'm not good enough but also I've got this other expectation of you can't you can't do it badly you have to do it well
the good thing is though like

yeah

it's getting your life together and getting starting a new life basically and having you know? having such like kind of llearning a new way of living which is the biggest thing the most important thing about first year like focus on your studies like if you wanna aim for a really high grade in your second and third year just work really hard but firfirst year is about just getting used to the experience and getting to know people and joining stuff and just I mean that's supposedly why it's like not everyone has a load of fun n at uni in first year but that's probably why they say like you'll have the time of your life because it's just
